intro: Libinhania acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf libinhania, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are tightly clustered along the stem, giving it a unique appearance. The plant is a perennial shrub that typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white in color and bloom during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Libinhania acicularis is considered a vulnerable species.
